title: 103_hr3810
content: The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" addresses eligibility for acquiring lands and rights-of-ways for treatment works and includes rural nonprofit water associations. It also focuses on capitalization grant agreements. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" focuses on capitalization grant agreements and encourages the use of innovative technologies in construction financed by the fund. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the useful life of the project. Loans can include interest-free or negative-interest options. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to allocate a portion of loans for negative-interest loans to rural and disadvantaged communities. Planning grants are also provided to cover up to 75% of planning and predevelopment costs for treatment works in these communities. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to allocate grants for rural and disadvantaged communities for project construction. Definitions for these communities are also provided. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide grants for project construction in rural and disadvantaged communities. A negative-interest loan is defined as a loan with zero interest rate and partial forgiveness of the principal for eligible communities. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to limit administrative costs to 4 percent of total funds deposited into the fund. Additionally, a technical assistance grant program is established under Title VI of the Act. Title VI of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to establish a Technical Assistance Grant Program. The Administrator may provide grants to organizations for training and assistance to rural and disadvantaged communities regarding treatment works. $15,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for this program until 1998. Section 607 of the Act is amended to exclude this new section.
